title: Kitchen Sink Cookies
markdown:
### Summary

Nathan,

Ok so as you know I do not have a good relationship with my own biological mother. I however don’t have all bad memories of our time together before I had to make the decision to remove her from our lives. One of the memories that I do have is about us making kitchen sink cookies together. She was a bit of a health nut and thought that these protein packed cookies could be a healthy snack. I however didn’t think that they would be that good so I was hesitant. These are so good that I had to redo my thinking on healthy snacks from then on. I love you dearly.

Mom

### Ingredients (dry* then wet**)

* * 1 cup whole wheat flour
* * ¼ cup soy flour
* * 1 ⅓ cups rolled oats
* * ¾ cups unsweetened flaked coconut
* * ¼ cup milk powder (⅓ cup instant)
* * ½ teaspoon salt
* * 1 teaspoon cinnamon
* * ½ teaspoon powdered ginger
* * ⅔ cups raisins (currants)
* * ⅔ cups chocolate chips
* * ¼ cup chopped peanuts
* * ⅓ cup sunflower seeds
* ** ¼ cup oil or melted butter
* ** ¼ cup molasses
* ** ¼ cup honey
* ** 2 eggs beaten
### Preparation

* Preheat oven to 350 degrees
* Mix all dry ingredients * in one bowl
* Mix all wet ingredients ** in separate bowl
* Combine the wet mixture into the dry mixture. If the dough is too dry add some milk or water until “drop cookie” consistency 
* Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 min
